result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin L King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:21 am-  Defendant Justin L King in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Wade Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Appearances remain the same.
11:22 am-  Jury enters Courtroom with Verdict. 
11:23 am-  Foreperson announces herself states Jurors have reached a Verdict. Signed Verdict forms handed to Judge Cameron.  Judge Cameron reads Jury's Verdict: Count 1- Guilty, Count 2- Guilty
11:24 am-  Atty. Krische asks Jury to be individually polled.  Jury is individually polled.
11:26 am-  Jury is thanked for this service and excused.
11:27 am-  ADA Newell requests PSI and Court orders PSI.   Court orders Defendant's bond shall remain in effect.  Court sets Sentencing Hearing for Thursday, 11/10/2016 at 1:30 p.m.  Court orders long form for PSI to be filed by 11/01/2016,                        Probation Agent doesn't need to attend Hearing.   
11:32 am-  Court adjourns.

9:00 am-  Defendant Justin L King in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Wade Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Cameron and Attys. go over final Jury Instructions.
9:07 am-  Jury enters Courtroom.  Judge Cameron reads Instructions to Jury.
9:23 am-  ADA Newell makes closing arguments .
9:38 am-  Atty. Krische makes closing arguments.
10:03 am-  ADA Newell makes rebuttle argument.
10:21 am-  Judge Cameron gives final Jury Instructions.
10:24 am-  Alternate Juror S.S. released from Jury Trial.
10:25 am-  Bailiffs A.V. and S.S. sworn.
10:26 am- Jurors leave Courtroom for deliberations.  
10:27 am-  Bailiff R.F. sworn.
Exhibits #8 and #9 in Exhibit Room, in Exhibit Bag with Exhibits #1, #2, #3

3:12 pm-  Court resumes, Defendant Justin L King in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Wade Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Appearances remain the same.
3:13 pm-  Jury re-enters Courtroom.
3:13 pm-  Witness, Robert Teuteberg, former Investigator sworn in and testifies.  ADA Newell questions witness R.T.
3:15 pm-  DVD is offered and played to the court.  Video segment was started at 15:50 and ended at 16:55. 
3:16 pm-  ADA Newell continues questioning witness, R.T.  Exhibit 9 is received by the Court. 
3:17 pm-  Atty. Krische cross-examines witness, R.T.  Atty. Kreische approaches and shows witness, R.T. his orig. report and continues cross-examination.
3:20 pm-  ADA Newell re-directs witness, R.T. Witness R.T. is excused.  State rests.
3:21 pm-  Jury exits Courtroom for short recess.
3:24 pm-  Jury re-enters Courtroom.  
3:25 pm-  Defense rests.  Jury is excused until 9:00 a.m. tomorrow, 08/30/2016 for day 2 of Jury Trial.
3:27 pm-  Jury exits courtroom.  Court to resume on 08/30/2016 at 9:00 a.m.
3:30 pm-  Judge Cameron and Attys. go through Jury Instructions and edit.  
3:33 pm-  Attys. given new Jury Instructions. Court is adjourned.

2:16 pm-  Court resumes, Defendant Justin L King in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Wade Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Appearances remain the same.
2:17 pm-  Witness, Deborah Brettingen, Investigator testifies.
2:17 pm-  ADA Newell offers and plays DVD for Court. 1st segment of video starts at 27:46 and stops at 28:06. 
2:20 pm-  DVD- 2nd segment of video starts at 50:00 and stops at 51:00.  Court receives Exhibit 8.
2:22 pm-  Atty. Kreische cross-examines witness, D.B.
2:23 pm-  Witness D.B. steps down from stand.
2:24 pm-  Witness, B.A. sworn in and testifies.  ADA Newell questions witness B.A.
2:27 pm-  Atty. Kreische cross-examines witness, B.A.
2:29 pm-  ADA Newell re-directs witness, B.A.
2:30 pm-  Atty. Kreische re-crosses witness, B.A.  Witness B.A. is excused.
2:31 pm-  Court breaks for 5-10 min.  
2:32 pm-  Court will now break until 3 p.m. as next Witness becomes available.

1:00 pm -  Court resumes, Defendant Justin L King in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Wade Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearances remain the same.
1:03 pm-   Jury re-enters Courtroom.
1:04 pm-   Witness Deborah Brettingen,Investigator sworn in and testifies.  Witness identifies Defendant in court.
1:13 pm-   Atty. Krische cross-examines witness, D.B.
1:18 pm-  ADA Newell re-directs witness, D.B.
1:22 pm-  Atty. Krische re-crosses witness, D.B.
1:25 pm-  ADA Newell re-directs witness, D.B.
1:25 pm-  Atty. Krische re-crosses witness, D.B.
1:26 pm-  Witness D.B. steps down.
1:27 pm-  Witness B.B. sworn in and testifies.  ADA Newell questions witness B.B.
1:27 pm-  Witness B.B. identifies Defendant in Court.
1:35 pm-  Exhibit 4 is offered to Witness, B.B. by ADA Newell.
1:40 pm-  Atty. Krische cross-examines witness, B.B.
1:48 pm-  Atty. Krische offers Exhibits 5, 6, and 7 to witness, B.B.  Court receives Exhibits 5, 6 and 7.
1:49 pm-  Atty. Krische continues cross-examination of witness, B.B.
1:55 pm-  ADA Newell re-directs witness, B.B.
1:57 pm-  Atty. Kreische re-crosses, witness, B.B,
1:57 pm- witness, B.B. steps down.
1:58 pm- Court recesses until 2:15 p.m.  Jury exits courtroom.

11:17 am Wade Newell appeared for the State of Wisconsin
11:17 am Matthew Krische appeared for Justin L. King.
11:17 am Defendant Justin L. King in court with attorney Matthew Krische.
11:17 am Court on the record without Juror's present.

11:21 am Jurors return.

11:29 am Attorney Krische makes opening remarks.
11:37 am Laura McClure sworn and testified.
11:38 am Witness identifies defendant. 
11:49 am Exhibit #1 received and Judge states it may be shown to the jury.
11:50 am Exhibit #2 received and Judge states it may be shown to the jury.
11:51 am Exhibit #3 received and Judge states it may be shown to the jury.
11:53 am Witness cross-examined.
11:57 am Witness re-direct.
12:00 pm Witness cross-examined.
12:00 pm Recessed for lunch andto be back on the record at 01:00 pm
